title: Ticket #16: Create test program for the ProcD
description:
Action on this was most recently prompted by a request from the VDT; since they ship a version of the ProcD, they'd like to add a test for it to their automated tests. Of course, this is something we should be testing in Condor's nightlies as well.

I have a test nearly ready to go, it just needs a bit more debugging love.
remarks:
2009-Jan-26 12:11:46 by gquinn:
All coding for this ticket done thus far is sitting in V7_3-procd_test-branch.

2009-Feb-23 13:25:23 by gquinn:
A ProcD test program has been checked into the master. Its Python source files are in the src/condor_procd directory. The test relies on a new tool called procd_ctl which provides a command line interface for sending commands to the ProcD.

Comments in the test's source files give a decent overview of how to run the test. Start with procd_test_controller.py, which is the test's top-level file.
